alert.note: Alert for Coshocton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 28 at 5:53AM EDT until March 28 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC031-281500- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0004.000000T0000Z-230328T2100Z/ /CSHO1.1.ER.230326T1922Z.230327T1845Z.230328T1500Z.NO/ 553 AM EDT Tue Mar 28 2023 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River at Coshocton. * WHEN...Until midday. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water reaches low lying areas between Tuscarawas and Walhonding Rivers just upstream of the confluence of the two rivers. At 15.0 feet, Low areas are flooded and water reaches a few homes along Route 16 south of Coshocton and along County Route 1A north of Coshocton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM EDT Tuesday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM EDT Tuesday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 11.7 feet Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.9 feet on 02/13/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
